meanings.definition: The process of adjusting the spacing between characters in a font.
meanings.sent1: During the kerning process, the designer made sure each letter fit perfectly next to the other.
meanings.sent2: Proper kerning is essential for making text easy to read and visually appealing.
meanings.sent3: The font was so poorly kerned that the letters seemed to be dancing off the page!
meanings.sent4: Her attention to kerning was like a conductor harmonizing each letter in a symphony of words.
meanings.sent5: The meticulous kerning transformed the text into a work of art.

meanings.definition: The space between letters in a printed text.
meanings.sent1: The kerning in the book was so tight that the words almost seemed to blend together.
meanings.sent2: Legible text depends on appropriate kerning to ensure each letter stands out clearly.
meanings.sent3: The kerning in the newspaper was so wide that the letters looked like they were taking a break from each other.
meanings.sent4: The kerning in the poster was like a well-choreographed dance, each letter perfectly in its place.
meanings.sent5: The kerning in the logo was so precise that it caught the eye of every passerby.
